Program Kontra Radikal, Polda Sulteng Dialog Bareng Mantan Napiter
06 Nov 2019, 13:03 by Alfreds Tuter


Program Kontra Radikal, Polda Sulteng Dialog Bareng Mantan Napiter

KBRN, Sulteng: Sebanyak 5 mantan Narapidana Teroris (Napiter) Poso, Sulawesi Tengah diundang langsung dalam kegiatan Kontra Radikal Polda Sulawesi Tengah bertajuk "Tangkal Radikalisme Menuju Indonesia Maju" di Gedung Pertemuan Polda Sulteng Torabelo, Palu, Sulteng, Rabu (6/11/2019). 
Salah satunya, Ustad Hasanuddin yang mengaku bergabung dengan jaringan teroris saat masih menjadi mahasiswa, bahkan dia mengaku sampai berangkat ke Filipina untuk mengikuti dengan kelompok radikal disana.
"Dulu mahasiswa, ada binaan - binaan khusus dan yang lain, kemudian sampai berangkat ke Filipina dan lain lain itulah proses, panjang sebenarny," kata Hasanuddin.
Namun seiring berjalannya waktu, dia ditangkap kemudian menjalani hukuman dan akhirnya dia menyesali segala perbuatannya. Dirinya sadar perbedaan di Indonesia merupakan sebuah keniscayaan yang perlu dijaga bersama.
"Ya kita hidup realistis aja ya, ketika masuk dipenjara kemudian kita banyak membaca, banyak merenung, kemudian juga punya tanggung jawab keluarga, masyarakat, anak didik kita. Bahwa hidup ini tidak bisa dipaksakan sesuai kemauan kita, ada orang lain, ada yang berbeda, itu keniscayaan yang harus kita hadapi," tuturnya.
Sekarang dia mengaku tengah sibuk bergelut mengurusi dunia pendidikan di Poso, sekaligus mengurus 2 pondok pesantren miliknya.
"Kesibukan saya sebagai Wakil Ketua Yayasan Amanatul Ummah Poso, yang bidang garabnya, pendidikan, dakwah dan sosial, kemanusiaan, pendidikan ada 18 unit dari paud/TK sampai Aliyah dan pondok pesantren, Bidang Usaha Ekonomi ada Koperasi sembako, UD. Herbal dan baju Muslim, perkebunan, BMT Perkreditan. Pondok Pesantren Islam Amanah Putra dan Putri di Poso juga," tutupnya.
Sementara Wakapolda Sulteng, Brigjen Pol Nurwindyanto mengatakan acara tersebut selain untuk menjaga kebhinekaan Indonesia dan mencegah berkembangnya paham radikal juga bagian dari menjaga keamanan ditengah masyarakat. Sehingga kondisi stabiltas yang aman akan membuka peluang investasi.
"Pasti ada (hubungan pencegahan paham rsdikal berkembang dengan iklim investasi) karena investasi berjalan dengan baik apabila keamanan terjaga. Kalau itu terjaga tentunya akan berjalan dengan baik seperti arahan Presiden, Joko Widodo, harapannya tidak hanya di Sulteng tapi di berbagai tempat," ucapnya.
Lebih lanjut Nurwindyanto menjelaskan alasan Polda Sulteng menghadirkan para mantan Napiter untuk memberikan contoh kongkrit kepada masyarakat setiap orang dapat berubah menjadi pribadi yang lebih baik, menghargai perbedaan yang menjadi takdir Indonesia.
"Napiter ini adalah mereka salah satu bisa korban bisa juga pelaku , namun kita melihat sisi kemanusiannya akan mengambil bagaimana bisa dari negatif menjadi positif, karena tidak mungkinlah orang akan menjadi salah terus, positifnya dia ingin berbuat sesuatu, mungkin caranya yang tidak benar," tuturnya.
Untuk itu Nurwindyanto mengajak masyarakat untuk sama-sama bergerak pro aktif menjaga toleransi umat beragama untuk persatuan yang lebih solid kedepannya.
"Tentunya ikutlah bersama sama membangun dengan segala potensi yang ada," pungkasnya.

Radical Counter Program, Central Sulawesi Regional Police Dialogue with Former Napiter
Nov 06 2019, 13:03 by Alfreds Tuter


Radical Counter Program, Central Sulawesi Regional Police Dialogue with Former Napiter

KBRN, Central Sulawesi: As many as 5 former Poso Terrorist Prisoners (Napiter), Central Sulawesi were invited directly to the Central Sulawesi Regional Police Radical Counter activity entitled "Preventing Radicalism Towards Advanced Indonesia" at the Central Sulawesi Regional Police Building in Torabelo, Palu, Central Sulawesi, Wednesday (6/11 / 2019).
One of them, Ustad Hasanuddin who claimed to join the terrorist network while still a student, even admitted to leaving for the Philippines to join the radical groups there.
"In the past students, there were special fosterions and others, then they went to the Philippines and others. That was a long, real process," Hasanuddin said.
But over time, he was arrested and then served his sentence and finally he regretted all his actions. He is aware of differences in Indonesia is a necessity that needs to be maintained together.
"Yes, we just live realistically, when we go to jail, then we read a lot, reflect a lot, then also have the responsibility of our family, community, our students. That life cannot be forced according to our wishes, there are others, there are different, that is a necessity that we must face, "he said.
Now he claims to be busy dealing with the world of education in Poso, as well as taking care of his two Islamic boarding schools.
"I am busy as the Deputy Chairperson of the Amanatul Ummah Poso Foundation, in the fields of garab, education, propaganda and social affairs, humanity, education, there are 18 units from paud / kindergarten to Aliyah and Islamic boarding schools. "Plantation, BMT Credit. Amanah Putra and Putri Islamic Islamic Boarding School in Poso too," he concluded.
While the Deputy Chief of Central Sulawesi Central Police, Brigadier General Nurwindyanto said the event was not only to maintain the diversity of Indonesia and prevent the development of radical understanding, it was also part of maintaining security in the community. So that the stability of a stable condition will open investment opportunities.
"There must be (the relationship between developing physical understanding and the investment climate) because investment goes well if security is maintained. If it is maintained, it will certainly go well as directed by the President, Joko Widodo, the hope is not only in Central Sulawesi but in various places," he said.
Nurwindyanto further explained the reason why the Central Sulawesi Regional Police presented former ex-military officers to give concrete examples to the community that everyone could turn into a better person, respecting the differences that were destined for Indonesia.
"These marriages are those who can be victims or perpetrators, but we see that humanity will take how it can be from negative to positive, because it is impossible for people to continue to be wrong, positive they want to do something, maybe the way is not right," he said .
For this reason, Nurwindyanto invited the public to move proactively to maintain religious tolerance for a more solid unity going forward.
"Surely come along together to build with all the potential that exists," he concluded.
